measured_by: dishonesty rate in the modified signaling game (percentage of wrong advice sent)
justification: "We first defined sending wrong information in conflict trials as dishonesty and calculated the dishonesty rate here as one of the dependent variables."

measured_by: alpha (α) parameter from the Constant Elasticity of Substitution utility model
justification: "Specifically, the alpha (α) parameter quantifies the relative weight between monetary payoffs for self and others, the larger α indicates a larger weight on the own economic gain."

measured_by: delta (δ) parameter from the Constant Elasticity of Substitution utility model
justification: "Model parameter delta (…, the larger, the more care about honesty) quantifies the bias effects of honesty concerns."

measured_by: drift rate (v) parameter in the Drift Diffusion Model
justification: "The drift rate represents the average slope of the accumulation process towards the boundaries. The larger the drift rate, the stronger evidence accumulated for the corresponding response option."

measured_by: mouse-tracking indices MAD (maximum deviation) and AUC (area under the curve)
justification: The paper notes that MAD and AUC "provide more information in the dynamic of decision" and are used to reveal "hesitating or changing mind halfway."
